title: Chief Information Officer (CIO)
label: Chief Information Officer (CIO)
description: Leads enterprise IT strategy, infrastructure, security, and digital transformation initiatives, responsible for technology platforms, cybersecurity, IT operations, and aligning technology with business objectives.
responsibilities: Set IT strategy and technology roadmap
Oversee IT operations, infrastructure, and security
Manage IT budget and vendor relationships
Drive digital transformation initiatives
Ensure business continuity and disaster recovery
Report to board on technology risks and opportunities
traditionalWorkflow: React to outages after they impact customers (no predictive capability)
Monthly IT performance reviews with delayed metrics
Quarterly security posture assessments
Annual technology strategy planning (3-6 months process)
IT spend tracked reactively (budget overruns common)
agenticWorkflow: Real-time IT health dashboards predict issues before customer impact
Weekly automated performance reports with trend analysis
Continuous security monitoring with real-time risk scoring
Rolling technology roadmaps updated monthly with AI insights
Real-time IT spend visibility with predictive budget forecasting
painPointsAddressed: Security breach detection 95% faster (1-7 days vs 200+ days)

title: IT Operations Manager
label: IT Operations Manager
description: Manages day-to-day IT infrastructure operations including monitoring, incident response, problem management, and ensuring service availability and performance.
responsibilities: Oversee IT infrastructure monitoring and alerting
Manage incident response and war rooms
Ensure SLA compliance for IT services
Coordinate with DevOps and SRE teams
Implement automation and self-healing capabilities
Drive continuous improvement in operational efficiency
traditionalWorkflow: Respond to alert storms during outages (chaotic war rooms)
Manually correlate alerts to identify root cause
Review MTTR and MTTD metrics weekly (lagging indicators)
Approve runbook executions manually (bottleneck)
Conduct post-incident reviews days after incidents
agenticWorkflow: AI correlates alerts automatically, creates single incident
Root cause analysis provided by ML in minutes
Real-time MTTR and MTTD dashboards with predictive trends
Auto-remediation executes runbooks with 60-80% success rate
Post-incident reports auto-generated immediately

title: Security Operations Lead (SOC Manager)
label: Security Operations Lead
description: Leads security operations center (SOC) managing threat detection, incident response, vulnerability management, and security monitoring to protect enterprise assets.
responsibilities: Manage SOC analysts and security monitoring
Oversee threat detection and incident response
Coordinate vulnerability management program
Implement security automation (SOAR)
Conduct threat hunting and forensics
Report security posture to CISO and leadership
traditionalWorkflow: Review 5,000-50,000 security alerts per day manually
Spend 10-40 hours per investigation searching video footage
Reactive threat response (discover breaches 200+ days later)
Monthly vulnerability scans (findings outdated by remediation)
Annual phishing simulations (if at all)
agenticWorkflow: AI filters to 500 actionable alerts (90% noise reduction)
Automated investigation provides evidence in minutes
Proactive threat hunting detects breaches in 1-7 days
Continuous vulnerability scanning with auto-patching
Ongoing phishing simulations with targeted micro-training
painPointsAddressed: MTTR reduced to 10 min - 4 hours (vs 3-30 days)
kpis: Mean Time to Respond to Incident

title: IT Service Manager
label: IT Service Manager
description: Manages IT service delivery including service desk operations, ticket management, SLA compliance, and continuous service improvement.
responsibilities: Oversee service desk operations and technician teams
Ensure SLA compliance and customer satisfaction
Manage ITSM platform and automation
Drive continuous improvement through problem management
Coordinate knowledge management and self-service
Report service metrics to IT leadership
traditionalWorkflow: Monitor ticket backlog of 500-2,000 open tickets
Review service desk metrics weekly (lagging indicators)
Manually route escalated tickets (60-70% escalation rate)
Update knowledge base sporadically (tribal knowledge issue)
Investigate SLA breaches after they occur
agenticWorkflow: Real-time ticket dashboard with automated routing
Daily automated service metrics with trend predictions
AI chatbot resolves 40-60% of requests (no escalation)
Knowledge articles auto-generated from solved tickets
SLA monitoring with proactive alerts before breach

title: IT Asset Manager
label: IT Asset Manager
description: Manages IT asset lifecycle from procurement through retirement, ensuring inventory accuracy, license compliance, cost optimization, and audit readiness.
responsibilities: Maintain accurate inventory of all IT assets
Ensure software license compliance
Manage asset procurement and provisioning
Track asset lifecycle (warranties, end-of-life)
Optimize software license spend
Prepare for IT asset audits
traditionalWorkflow: Update asset spreadsheet manually (always outdated)
Conduct annual license audit (discover compliance gaps)
Process laptop procurement requests in 1-3 weeks
Track warranty expirations in calendar reminders
Discover shadow IT during vendor audits (100-500 apps)
agenticWorkflow: Automated asset discovery maintains 95%+ accuracy
Continuous license monitoring ensures 99% compliance
Auto-approve laptop requests, provision in 1-3 days
Warranty tracking with automated renewal recommendations
Shadow IT discovered continuously via SSO log analysis
painPointsAddressed: Provisioning time reduced to 1-3 days (vs 1-3 weeks)
